entries.title: Florida Congressman Leaves Hospital After Ladder Accident
entries.description: Representative Greg Steube tweeted Saturday that he has been discharged from the hospital and will soon provide updates on how his recovery will affect his return to Washington.

entries.title: Lula Fires Brazil’s Top Army Chief Arruda After Riots in Capital
entries.description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva dismissed the nation’s top army commander on Saturday, two weeks after rioters stormed public buildings in the capital, Brasilia.

entries.title: UK Tory Chairman Zahawi Acknowledges Being ‘Careless’ With Taxes
entries.description: UK Conservative Party Chairman Nadhim Zahawi acknowledged being “careless” with his tax affairs and said he settled a bill over shares in a polling company he co-founded, seeking to defuse a controversy threatening to knock Rishi Sunak’s government off course.

entries.title: White House Chief of Staff Ron Klain to Depart In Coming Weeks
entries.description: President Joe Biden’s chief of staff, Ron Klain, is preparing to leave his post in the coming weeks, a high-profile departure as the White House faces two years of a divided Congress and prepares for an expected reelection bid, people familiar with the matter said.

entries.title: Brazil’s Lula Pledges to Eliminate Illegal Mining, Help Yanomami
entries.description: Illegal mining will be eliminated in Brazil, President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva told journalists after visiting an institution for indigenous healthcare in Boa Vista, Roraima state, in the Amazon region.

entries.title: Yellen Says China May Be Prepared to Join Zambia Debt Deal
entries.description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen again expressed cautious optimism that China will be willing to enter into a multilateral debt restructuring deal with Zambia.

entries.title: Yellen Sees Success in Extending Russia Price Cap, Despite Risks
entries.description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen expressed confidence that restrictions on Russian sales of crude oil can be expanded to refined petroleum products in February, while acknowledging that the task will be more complicated.

entries.title: Venezuela Frees Former Intelligence Chief Who Became Maduro Foe
entries.description: Venezuela freed the former head of the government’s intelligence agency five years after he was arrested for allegedly instigating a rebellion against President Nicolas Maduro, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Colombia, Venezuela Reach Joint Investment Protection Agreement
entries.description: Colombia and Venezuela reached an agreement to strengthen investment protections between the two nations, the latest accord to cement warmer trade relations between the South American neighbors.

entries.title: Peru Closes Machu Picchu to Tourists as Protests Intensify
entries.description: Peru’s Ministry of Culture will close the Machu Picchu and Inca Trail archaeological sites until further notice due to intensifying protests in the Andean nation calling for the removal of President Dina Boluarte.

entries.title: Chris Hipkins’ Journey From Police Cell to New Zealand’s Next Prime Minister
entries.description: New Zealand’s next prime minister credits time spent in a police cell for sparking his interest in national politics.

entries.title: Trump Not Scared by Judge’s Million-Dollar Smack, Experts Say
entries.description: A court order that Donald Trump and his lawyer must pay almost $1 million in sanctions for filing an “abusive” lawsuit against Hillary Clinton probably won’t succeed in deterring him, legal experts say.

entries.title: Social Media Buzz: Lunar New Year, Nikki Haley, Djokovic, Abbott
entries.description: What’s buzzing on social media this morning:

entries.title: People Smuggling Boss Who Went on Run Ahead of Sentencing Arrested at UK Airport
entries.description: The head of a Kurdish people smuggling ring has been arrested after going on the run ahead of his sentencing, the National Crime Agency (NCA) said.

entries.title: Zahawi Admits He Paid Settlement After HMRC Disagreed With Allocation of Shares
entries.description: Nadhim Zahawi has admitted he paid a tax settlement after HM Revenue & Customs disagreed with the allocation of founder shares his father took when he set up YouGov.

entries.title: Sinn Fein Welcomes US Congressional Letter on Northern Ireland Law Plans
entries.description: A US Congressional letter to the Prime Minister expressing concern about the UK Government's "dangerous" Troubles legacy plans is a "significant intervention", Michelle O'Neill has said.

entries.title: The Race to Arm Ukraine, China’s Covid Wave: Weekend Reads
entries.description: The US and its allies didn’t reach a decision on whether to send Germany’s Leopard battle tanks to Ukraine, and US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin said time is running out to provide Kyiv with advanced weapons before an expected Russian offensive in the spring.

entries.title: India Blocks Social Media Posts on BBC Documentary on 2002 Riots
entries.description: The Indian government has asked social media giants Twitter Inc. and Alphabet Inc.’s YouTube to take down videos and tweets about a BBC documentary on 2002 religious riots in Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s home state of Gujarat.

entries.title: Your Saturday UK Briefing: Sunak Buckles Up for Crunch Pay Talks
entries.description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.

entries.title: Raab Says He Always ‘Behaved Professionally’ as Bullying Probe Continues
entries.description: Dominic Raab insisted he has always "behaved professionally" as he declined to comment on the status of the bullying inquiry against him.

entries.title: Nadhim Zahawi’s Position ‘Untenable’ After Tax Penalty Reports, Says Labour
entries.description: Tory party chairman Nadhim Zahawi's position is "untenable", Labour has said after reports that he paid a penalty as part of a multimillion-pound tax settlement.

entries.title: Nigeria Names Ex-Finance Minister to Revitalize Investment Firm
entries.description: Nigeria’s president named former finance minister Shamsuddeen Usman to lead Ministry of Finance Incorporated (MOFI), a state-owned asset management firm being overhauled to make it more efficient.

entries.title: Turkey Cancels Swedish Minister’s Visit in Latest Koran Tension
entries.description: Turkey canceled next week’s visit by Swedish Defense Minister Pal Jonson as tension flared over permission given by Stockholm for a public burning of the Islam’s holy book Koran.

entries.title: Long-Closed Algeria Seeks Tourists to Bank Vacation Dollars
entries.description: After Saudi Arabia opened its doors to foreign tourists for the first time in 2019, one of the last remaining Arab countries still largely closed off to holidaymakers is set to follow suit.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: US Defense Chief Warns of New Russian Offensive
entries.description: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin warned that Ukraine needs advanced weapons before an expected new Russian offensive — even as the US and Germany hold out on Kyiv’s requests for their most powerful main battle tanks. “We have a window of opportunity here between now and the spring, whenever they commence their operation,” Austin said after a meeting of the Ukraine Defense Contact Group.

entries.title: What Europe Risks With Wider Sanctions on Russian Oil
entries.description: The campaign by western nations to defund the Kremlin and force President Vladimir Putin to abandon his war in Ukraine is reaching a delicate phase. From Feb. 5, the European Union will join the UK and the US in banning seaborne imports of Russian diesel and other oil products. The measure, coupled with a price cap on Russian fuel exports, is designed to blow a sizable hole in Moscow’s energy revenues. entries.title: Mini Refineries Lead Nigeria’s Quest to Process Own Crude Oil
entries.description: On a river bank deep in the Niger Delta a local contractor is building one of a growing number of mini refineries that the Nigerian government hopes will finally help wean Africa’s biggest economy off foreign fuel.

entries.title: UK’s Sunak Looks to Pay Deals to Avert February Strike Chaos
entries.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will look to begin closing a series of pay deals with trade unions, as the government enters 10 days of crunch talks ahead of coordinated strike action planned for early February.

entries.title: Trump Drops NY Tax Return Fight Because GOP ‘Has No Interest’
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump has dropped a long-running court fight with Congress over access to his New York state tax returns, notifying a judge late Friday in a joint filing with a House committee that the new Republican leadership “has no interest” in the documents.

entries.title: Meta Lobbying Spending Dips as Job Cuts, Costs Surge
entries.description: Meta Platforms Inc.’s spending on lobbying decreased by about $1 million during the final three months of 2022 compared to the previous quarter, according to filings posted on Friday.
